Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the other party was unwilling to provide the president and his party a victory in passing immigration bills.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that both presidents' immigration bills failed solely due to the other party's unwillingness.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reason the immigration bills did not work was solely because the other party was unwilling to provide a victory, without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the role of Republican opposition to Obama's immigration efforts in 2013 and misrepresents the Democratic support for Bush's immigration bill in 2006.
